page.title: 07TRADE IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: 7.CHEQUERS PUB.,dating from the 15th century when it was a coaching inn, is said to be haunted by prisoners from Mary Tudor's reign, who were locked up before being burned. In 1953 exorcism was attempted but failed. In 1964 the new manager asked a medium for help. At that time a white-hooded figure appeared, doors opened and screaming was heard.Afterwards all was quiet until 1978 when the ghost reappeared. It is still seen occasionally. 8.AMERSHAM BUS GARAGE,opened in 1935 and costing Â£1,000 to build, now has 59 buses and employs 103 drivers, 14 mechanics, 11 office staff, 1 painter, 1 cleaner, 5 inspectors, 5 depot staff and 30 engineers. Drivers earn Â£130 a week, mechanics Â£120.To buy a double decker costs Â£80,000,a single decker Â£70,000 and a coach Â£80,000.The garage in total is worth Â£4,370,000.
